001package squidpony;
002
003import java.awt.Color;
004import java.awt.Component;
005import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
006import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008import java.util.HashMap;
009import java.util.Map;
010import java.util.Queue;
011import java.util.TreeMap;
012import javax.swing.JColorChooser;
013import javax.swing.JDialog;
014import javax.swing.colorchooser.AbstractColorChooserPanel;
015import squidpony.squidmath.Bresenham;
016import squidpony.squidmath.Point3D;
017import squidpony.squidmath.RNG;
018
019/**
020 * Provides utilities for working with colors as well as caching operations for
021 * color creation.
022 *
023 * All returned SColor objects are cached so multiple requests for the same
024 * SColor will not create duplicate long term objects.
025 *
026 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
027 */
028public class SColorFactory {
029
030    private static final TreeMap<String, SColor> nameLookup = new TreeMap<>();
031    private static final TreeMap<Integer, SColor> valueLookup = new TreeMap<>();
032    private static RNG rng = new RNG();
033    private static Map<Integer, SColor> colorBag = new HashMap<>();
034    private static Map<String, ArrayList<SColor>> pallets = new HashMap<>();
035    private static int floor = 1;//what multiple to floor rgb values to in order to reduce total colors
036
037    /**
038     * Prevents any instances from being created.
039     */
040    private SColorFactory() {
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Returns the SColor Constant who's name is the one provided. If one cannot
045     * be found then null is returned.
046     *
047     * This method constructs a list of the SColor constants the first time it
048     * is called.
049     *
050     * @param s
051     * @return
052     */
053    public static SColor colorForName(String s) {
054        if (nameLookup.isEmpty()) {
055            for (SColor sc : SColor.FULL_PALLET) {
056                nameLookup.put(sc.getName(), sc);
057            }
058        }
059
060        return nameLookup.get(s);
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Returns the SColor who's value matches the one passed in. If no SColor
065     * Constant matches that value then a cached or new SColor is returned that
066     * matches the provided value.
067     *
068     * This method constructs a list of the SColor constants the first time it
069     * is called.
070     *
071     * @param rgb
072     * @return
073     */
074    public static SColor colorForValue(int rgb) {
075        if (valueLookup.isEmpty()) {
076            for (SColor sc : SColor.FULL_PALLET) {
077                valueLookup.put(sc.getRGB(), sc);
078            }
079        }
080
081        return valueLookup.containsKey(rgb) ? valueLookup.get(rgb) : asSColor(rgb);
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Returns the number of SColor objects currently cached.
086     *
087     * @return
088     */
089    public static int quantityCached() {
090        return colorBag.size();
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Utility method to blend the two colors by the amount passed in as the
095     * coefficient.
096     *
097     * @param a
098     * @param b
099     * @param coef
100     * @return
101     */
102    private static int blend(int a, int b, double coef) {
103        coef = Math.min(1, coef);
104        coef = Math.max(0, coef);
105        return (int) (a + (b - a) * coef);
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Returns an SColor that is the given distance from the first color to the
110     * second color.
111     *
112     * @param color1 The first color
113     * @param color2 The second color
114     * @param coef The percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
115     * @return
116     */
117    public static SColor blend(SColor color1, SColor color2, double coef) {
118        return asSColor(blend(color1.getAlpha(), color2.getAlpha(), coef),
119                blend(color1.getRed(), color2.getRed(), coef),
120                blend(color1.getGreen(), color2.getGreen(), coef),
121                blend(color1.getBlue(), color2.getBlue(), coef));
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Returns an SColor that is randomly chosen from the color line between the
126     * two provided colors from the two provided points.
127     *
128     * @param color1
129     * @param color2
130     * @param min The minimum percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
131     * @param max The maximum percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
132     * @return
133     */
134    public static SColor randomBlend(SColor color1, SColor color2, double min, double max) {
135        return blend(color1, color2, rng.between(min, max));
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Adds the two colors together.
140     *
141     * @param color1
142     * @param color2
143     * @return
144     */
145    public static SColor add(SColor color1, SColor color2) {
146        return asSColor(color1.getAlpha() + color2.getAlpha(), color1.getRed() + color2.getRed(), color1.getGreen() + color2.getGreen(), color1.getBlue() + color2.getBlue());
147    }
148
149    /**
150     * Uses the second color as a light source, meaning that each of the red,
151     * green, and blue values of the first color are multiplied by the lighting
152     * color's percentage of full value (255).
153     *
154     * @param color
155     * @param light
156     * @return
157     */
158    public static SColor lightWith(SColor color, SColor light) {
159        return asSColor((int) (color.getAlpha() * light.getAlpha() / 255f), (int) (color.getRed() * light.getRed() / 255f), (int) (color.getGreen() * light.getGreen() / 255f), (int) (color.getBlue() * light.getBlue() / 255f));
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Clears the backing cache.
164     *
165     * Should only be used if an extreme number of colors are being created and
166     * then not reused, such as when blending different colors in different
167     * areas that will not be revisited.
168     */
169    public static void emptyCache() {
170        colorBag = new HashMap<>();
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * Sets the value at which each of the red, green, and blue values will be
175     * set to the nearest lower multiple of.
176     *
177     * For example, a floor value of 5 would mean that each of those values
178     * would be considered the nearest lower multiple of 5 when building the
179     * colors.
180     *
181     * If the value passed in is less than 1, then the flooring value is set at
182     * 1.
183     *
184     * @param value
185     */
186    public static void setFloor(int value) {
187        floor = Math.max(1, value);
188    }
189
190    /**
191     * Returns the cached color that matches the desired rgb value.
192     *
193     * If the color is not already in the cache, it is created and added to the
194     * cache.
195     *
196     * This method does not check to see if the value is already available as a
197     * SColor constant. If such functionality is desired then please use
198     * colorForValue(int rgb) instead.
199     *
200     * @param argb
201     * @return
202     */
203    public static SColor asSColor(int argb) {
204        int working = argb;
205        if (floor != 1) {//need to convert to floored values
206            int a = (argb >> 24) & 0xff;
207            a -= a % floor;
208            int r = (argb >> 16) & 0xff;
209            r -= r % floor;
210            int g = (argb >> 8) & 0xff;
211            g -= g % floor;
212            int b = argb & 0xff;
213            b -= b % floor;
214
215            //put back together
216            working = ((a & 0xFF) << 24)
217                    | ((r & 0xFF) << 16)
218                    | ((g & 0xFF) << 8)
219                    | (b & 0xFF);
220        }
221
222        if (colorBag.containsKey(working)) {
223            return colorBag.get(working);
224        } else {
225            SColor color = new SColor(working);
226            colorBag.put(working, color);
227            return color;
228        }
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Returns an SColor that is opaque.
233     *
234     * @param r
235     * @param g
236     * @param b
237     * @return
238     */
239    public static SColor asSColor(int r, int g, int b) {
240        return asSColor(255, r, g, b);
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Returns an SColor with the given values, with those values clamped
245     * between 0 and 255.
246     *
247     * @param a
248     * @param r
249     * @param g
250     * @param b
251     * @return
252     */
253    public static SColor asSColor(int a, int r, int g, int b) {
254        a = Math.min(a, 255);
255        a = Math.max(a, 0);
256        r = Math.min(r, 255);
257        r = Math.max(r, 0);
258        g = Math.min(g, 255);
259        g = Math.max(g, 0);
260        b = Math.min(b, 255);
261        b = Math.max(b, 0);
262        return asSColor(a * 256 * 256 * 256 + r * 256 * 256 + g * 256 + b);
263    }
264
265    /**
266     * Returns an SColor representation of the provided Color. If there is a
267     * named SColor constant that matches the value, then that constant is
268     * returned.
269     *
270     * @param color
271     * @return
272     */
273    public static SColor asSColor(Color color) {
274        return colorForValue(color.getRGB());
275    }
276
277    /**
278     * Returns an SColor that is a slightly dimmer version of the provided
279     * color.
280     *
281     * @param color
282     * @return
283     */
284    public static SColor dim(SColor color) {
285        return blend(color, SColor.BLACK, 0.1);
286    }
287
288    /**
289     * Returns an SColor that is a somewhat dimmer version of the provided
290     * color.
291     *
292     * @param color
293     * @return
294     */
295    public static SColor dimmer(SColor color) {
296        return blend(color, SColor.BLACK, 0.3);
297    }
298
299    /**
300     * Returns an SColor that is a lot darker version of the provided color.
301     *
302     * @param color
303     * @return
304     */
305    public static SColor dimmest(SColor color) {
306        return blend(color, SColor.BLACK, 0.7);
307    }
308
309    /**
310     * Returns an SColor that is a slightly lighter version of the provided
311     * color.
312     *
313     * @param color
314     * @return
315     */
316    public static SColor light(SColor color) {
317        return blend(color, SColor.WHITE, 0.1);
318    }
319
320    /**
321     * Returns an SColor that is a somewhat lighter version of the provided
322     * color.
323     *
324     * @param color
325     * @return
326     */
327    public static SColor lighter(SColor color) {
328        return blend(color, SColor.WHITE, 0.3);
329    }
330
331    /**
332     * Returns an SColor that is a lot lighter version of the provided color.
333     *
334     * @param color
335     * @return
336     */
337    public static SColor lightest(SColor color) {
338        return blend(color, SColor.WHITE, 0.6);
339    }
340
341    /**
342     * Returns an SColor that is the fully desaturated (greyscale) version of
343     * the provided color.
344     *
345     * @param color
346     * @return
347     */
348    public static SColor desaturated(SColor color) {
349        int r = color.getRed();
350        int g = color.getGreen();
351        int b = color.getBlue();
352        int average = (int) (r * 0.299 + g * 0.587 + b * 0.114);
353
354        return asSColor(average, average, average);
355    }
356
357    /**
358     * Returns an SColor that is the version of the provided color desaturated
359     * the given amount.
360     *
361     * @param color
362     * @param percent The percent to desaturate, from 0.0 for none to 1.0 for
363     * fully desaturated
364     * @return
365     */
366    public static SColor desaturate(SColor color, double percent) {
367        return blend(color, desaturated(color), percent);
368    }
369
370    /**
371     * Returns a list of colors starting at the first color and moving to the
372     * second color. The end point colors are included in the list.
373     *
374     * @param color1
375     * @param color2
376     * @return
377     */
378    public static ArrayList<SColor> asGradient(SColor color1, SColor color2) {
379        String name = palletNamer(color1, color2);
380        if (pallets.containsKey(name)) {
381            return pallets.get(name);
382        }
383
384        //get the gradient
385        Queue<Point3D> gradient = Bresenham.line3D(scolorToCoord3D(color1), scolorToCoord3D(color2));
386        ArrayList<SColor> ret = new ArrayList<>();
387        for (Point3D coord : gradient) {
388            ret.add(coord3DToSColor(coord));
389        }
390
391        pallets.put(name, ret);
392        return ret;
393    }
394
395    /**
396     * Returns the pallet associate with the provided name, or null if there is
397     * no such pallet.
398     *
399     * @param name
400     * @return
401     */
402    public static ArrayList<SColor> pallet(String name) {
403        return pallets.get(name);
404    }
405
406    /**
407     * Returns the SColor that is the provided percent towards the end of the
408     * pallet. Bounds are checked so as long as there is at least one color in
409     * the palette, values below 0 will return the first element and values
410     * above 1 will return the last element;
411     *
412     * If there is no pallette keyed to the provided name, null is returned.
413     *
414     * @param name
415     * @param percent
416     * @return
417     */
418    public static SColor fromPallet(String name, float percent) {
419        ArrayList<SColor> list = pallets.get(name);
420        if (list == null) {
421            return null;
422        }
423
424        int index = Math.round(list.size() * percent);//find the index that's the given percent into the gradient
425        index = Math.min(index, list.size() - 1);
426        index = Math.max(index, 0);
427        return list.get(index);
428    }
429
430    /**
431     * Presents a pop-up JColorChooser dialog showing all of the SColor
432     * constants along with examples of what the various dimming and lightening
433     * methods change them to..
434     *
435     * @param parent The component which is the parent of this dialog
436     * @return the SColor that is chosen in the dialog
437     */
438    public static SColor showSColorChooser(Component parent) {
439        final JColorChooser chooser = new JColorChooser();
440        chooser.setChooserPanels(new AbstractColorChooserPanel[]{new SColorChooserPanel()});
441
442        JDialog dialog = JColorChooser.createDialog(parent, "Choose A Color", true, chooser, new ActionListener() {
443            @Override
444            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
445                pickedColor = asSColor(chooser.getColor().getRGB());
446            }
447        }, null);
448        dialog.setLocationRelativeTo(parent);
449        dialog.setVisible(true);
450
451        return pickedColor;
452    }
453    private static SColor pickedColor;//needed for the color chooser
454
455    /**
456     * Places the pallet into the cache, along with each of the member colors.
457     *
458     * @param name
459     * @param pallet
460     */
461    public static void addPallet(String name, ArrayList<SColor> pallet) {
462        ArrayList<SColor> temp = new ArrayList<>();
463
464        //make sure all the colors in the pallet are also in the general color cache
465        for (SColor sc : pallet) {
466            temp.add(asSColor(sc.getRGB()));
467        }
468
469        pallets.put(name, temp);
470    }
471
472    /**
473     * Converts the provided color into a three dimensional coordinate point for
474     * use in the Bresenham algorithms.
475     *
476     * @param color
477     * @return
478     */
479    private static Point3D scolorToCoord3D(SColor color) {
480        return new Point3D(color.getRed(), color.getGreen(), color.getBlue());
481    }
482
483    /**
484     * Converts the provided three dimensional coordinate into a color for use
485     * in the Bresenham algorithms.
486     *
487     * @param coord
488     * @return
489     */
490    private static SColor coord3DToSColor(Point3D coord) {
491        return asSColor(coord.x, coord.y, coord.z);
492    }
493
494    private static String palletNamer(SColor color1, SColor color2) {
495        return color1.getName() + " to " + color2.getName();
496    }
497}
